Launch buttons inside the contract pull-down menu which only light up next to a particular contract when your craft is capable of fulfilling that mission (has the specified antenna, crew space, power, docking port etc).

[Edit] to elaborate a bit;

Clicking on the mission launch icon if your ship doesn't qualify gives you a reason (i.e. missing antenna! or insufficient crew space!)

Launching with the 'Launch Mission' button means other contracts in the pull-down will be minimized by default when you focus on that vessel (because you know what the mission that vessel is on)

Felipe (HarvesteR): This week, I finished up the new lift model for the lifting and control surfaces which I started last week. I also revised the fuel flow logic for air-breathing engines. To support things like wet wings and such in the future, turbine engines now drain resources evenly from all tanks in a stage (the stage grouping allows setting up drop-tanks and such). This should also help with maintaining a balanced craft as fuel is drained out, and reduce the need to use fuel lines excessively.

This confuses me.. so you've taken away fuel balancing, which is a fun part of designing a plane? What are you going to do next? Remove the wings?

I'd like to second the need for in flight action group editing. I NEVER seem to quite remember to set them up right. I think i am always rushing my designs a bit.

Also, a small feature i would love to see is less clicks to quit the game. From flight, I often need to click 7 menu items to get back to my desktop, several or which have small loading delays. I know, minor point, but it can be fairly annoying when i am trying to quit the game quickly (e.g. the wife is saying "lets go!!") and I have to click, wait, click, wait....

: )

Felipe (HarvesteR): This week, I finished up the new lift model for the lifting and control surfaces which I started last week. I also revised the fuel flow logic for air-breathing engines. To support things like wet wings and such in the future, turbine engines now drain resources evenly from all tanks in a stage (the stage grouping allows setting up drop-tanks and such). This should also help with maintaining a balanced craft as fuel is drained out, and reduce the need to use fuel lines excessively.

I like this! It just makes so much more sense, especially with multiple engines present. And it will greatly help with low-tech mark I planes where you only have a very limited number of parts and design variations available to you.

One of my common errors - leaving launch clamps in the default position in the staging list. I often press launch and discover that the clamps are only set to release at the same time as I drop the first stage.

I would say as a guideline that the clamps should be

in the first 2 stage groups - you can start engines before releasing the clamps

in a group before any decouplers - why bring something if you are just going to drop it on the pad?

in a group before any decouplers - why bring something if you are just going to drop it on the pad?

So you can test that mainsail landed at Kerbin and then leave it on the pad as you launch the main mission.

Of course, you can (and I do) just put it and the decoupler for it in the first stage, along with the boosters and stabalizers, unless I for some reason want to see the decoupling.
